passages.text:
(if: $day is 1)[Your brother answers on the (link-reveal:"third ring.")[

He has just put his daughter to bed. He tells you about her (link-reveal:"latest exploits.")[

(color:#E88666)[- a fort. The size of a house practically. I (link-reveal:"played the-")[

(color: #7DBCFF)[Eventually he mentions [[the election.->Day 1.1 family]]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 2)[You brother answers on the (link-reveal:"sixth ring.")[

He sounds (link-reveal:"a little shaken.")[

His wife went to (link-reveal:"the protest.")[

She wasn't hurt, but almost got caught up in (link-reveal:"some of the violence.")[

He says that the government are blaming the protesters for (link-reveal:"the violence.")[

But his wife is sure it (link-reveal:"wasn't the protesters' fault.")[

Some of the police shouted (link-reveal:"racist names at her.")[

Names she's not been called since (link-reveal:"first coming to this country.")[

In the background you can hear their daughter (link-reveal:"screaming.")[

He mentions something about teething and [[makes his excuses.->Next day]]
]]]]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 3)[Your brother answers on the (link-reveal:"second ring.")[

He asks about (link-reveal:"your work.")[

You tell him about the new rules and how they've made things more (set: $word1 to "busy")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["busy", "tedious", "fun", "scary"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word1");'>$word1</tw-link></mark>.

There's a moment of [[silence.->Day 3.1 Moving advice]]]]](elseif: $day is 4)[Your brother answers (link-reveal:"before the first ring has finished.")[

It's immediately clear he was (link-reveal:"expecting someone else's call.")[ And also clear that [[he's very worked up.->Day 4.1 family]]]]](elseif: $day is 5)[Your brother answers on the (link-reveal:"fourth ring.")[

He's just finished putting his daughter to bed and seems to be [[in a positive mood.->Day 5.1 family]]]](elseif: $day is 6)[Your brother answers on the (link-reveal:"sixth ring.")[

You make polite smalltalk about mutual acquaintances, but (link-reveal:"he seems on edge.")[

You ask him [[what's the matter.->Day 6.1 family]]]]](else:)[(set: $familygone to true)(set: $family to it -1)No one answers the phone. You make yourself a simple dinner and (link-reveal:"try again.")[

There's still no answer. Your brother doesn't tend to be out in the evenings as he likes to be on hand to tuck his daughter in. (link-reveal:"You try a third time.")[

[[Someone answers.->Day 7.1 family]]]]]

passages.name: go out alone for a drink
passages.text:
(if: $day is 1)[Your favourite bar is busy tonight. The country has a new president, and everyone is out celebrating or commiserating. You manage to snag (link-reveal:"the last bar stool.")[

The barman spots you and takes your order. Usually he regales you with stories of his childhood overseas, but this evening he's (link-reveal:"worked off his feet.")[

After half an hour a large group of men come in. They've clearly been [[drinking for some time.->Day 1.1]]

]]](elseif: $day is 2)[Your favourite bar is half full, about normal for a week night. You have a booth to yourself near the window where you can (link-reveal:"watch the world go by.")[

Groups of people are bar hopping, some of them already staggering their way (link-reveal:"down the street.")[

When you're halfway through your drink [[a young man runs into the bar.->Day 2.1 drink]]]]](elseif: $day is 3)[The bar is quiet, perfect for letting the evening wash over you while you (link-reveal:"sip your drink.")[

A couple of the regulars don't seem to be there (link-reveal:"tonight.")[

You ask the barman if he's seen them, but he (link-reveal:"just shrugs.")[

He seems out of sorts. Faced with a quiet night he would usually regale you with stories of his (link-reveal:"childhood in India.")[

As you start your second drink, (link-reveal:"a young couple walk in.")[

They look around the bar, whisper to each other, then (link-reveal:"walk straight back out again.")[

When you're ready to head home you...

[Leave your usual tip]<tip1|
[Leave no tip]<tip1|
[Leave a larger than usual tip]<tip2|
(click: ?tip1)[(goto: "Next day")]
(click: ?tip2)[(set: $suspicion to it +5)(goto: "Next day")]]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 4)[Your usual bar is (link-reveal:"quiet tonight.")[

In fact even the usual barman (link-reveal:"doesn't seem to be there.")[

Usually on a quiet night like this he would hold court at the bar, regaling whoever would listen with stories about (link-reveal:"growing up in India.")[

Instead a dour-faced replacement simply shrugs when (link-reveal:"you ask after him.")[

You sit in the window and watch the world go by. (link-reveal:"The drink still tastes fine.")[

[[As does the second.->Next day]]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 5)[There's a private function taking over half of (link-reveal:"your favourite bar.")[

You manage to grab the last booth for yourself and watch as the function descends from a relatively formal affair to (link-reveal:"drunken dancing.")[

When you return to your table after buying a second drink, [[a slip of paper has materialised.->Day 5.1 drink]]]]](elseif: $day is 6)[Your favourite bar has gone downhill over the last few weeks, losing some of the character that (link-reveal:"made it distinct.")[

Some of the nicer drinks are no longer available following the strict import criteria (link-reveal:"the government has imposed.")[

There are a handful of alright homegrown drinks though, so you stick to those as you ease back in your chair and (link-reveal:"watch the world troop past outside.")[

As you walk home it seems to you like [[there are more police cars out patrolling.->Night 6]]]]]](elseif: $day is 7)[The city centre (link-reveal:"is crowded tonight.")[

Groups totter from bar to bar while you perch in the window of (link-reveal:"your favourite haunt.")[

The atmosphere is like (link-reveal:"a major sporting victory.")[

But there [[hasn't been a match.->Day 7.1 drink]]]]]](elseif: $day is 8)[It's a quiet night. From the window of the bar you watch people (link-reveal:"trickle along the main road.")[

When you're halfway through your first drink someone legs it past the window, (link-reveal:"shoving people out of the way as they go.")[

It was a woman, (link-reveal:"tall and brunette.")[

Two minutes later the police thunder past. One of them doubles back when he [[sees you in the window.->Day 8.1 drink]]]]]](elseif: $day is 9)[Your usual bar is (link-reveal:"packed.")[

Groups cluster together, sporadic bursts of laughter as (link-reveal:"deafening as sirens.")[

(if:$code3 is true)[You were hoping for a bit of quiet to think through the latest missive from the resistance. Instead you feel on edge.](else:)[Although the atmosphere is festive, you're quite happy drinking alone.]

Someone approaches you and invites you to (link-reveal:"join their group.")[

They tell you they're celebrating (link-reveal:"taking the country back.")[

You...

[[Fob them off and leave.->Next day]]

[[Join them.->Day 9.1 drink]]]]]]]
(else:)[ ]

(if: $day is 1)[(set: $friend to it + 1)Your friend is a professor of literature at one of the country's (link-reveal:"middle-ranking universities.")[

It's been a few weeks since you saw each other, but before the first few pleasantries are out of your mouth she [[launches into the election results.->Day 1.1 friend]]]](elseif: $day is 2)[(set: $friend to it + 1)(set:$suspicion to it +10)You have to wait for almost half an hour before (link-reveal:"your friend arrives.")[

You ask if she's been stuck in (link-reveal:"a faculty meeting.")[

(color:#E88666)[I was at the protest with some of my students.]

You mention the woman from the train with the (link-reveal:"bloody nose.")[

(color:#E88666)[I think [[we were lucky.->Day 2.1 friend]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 3)[(set: $friend to it + 1)Your friend has drinks ready and waiting when you arrive. She seems to be in a good mood and (link-reveal:"you tell her as much.")[

(color:#E88666)[The students have me fired up. Teaching them is an inspiration.] She lowers her voice and tells you about the plans her students have been concocting in an effort to bypass the new law making the [[protests illegal.->Day 3.1 friend]]]](elseif: $day is 4)[(set: $friend to it + 1)You arrive at the bar first and get the drinks in, but your friend (link-reveal:"isn't far behind.")[

She immediately starts telling you about a letter she has received, notifying her that her behaviour is being monitored following [[an anonymous complaint.->Day 4.1 friend]]]](elseif: $day is 5)[(set: $friend to it + 1)Your friend arrives shortly after you. She (link-reveal:"seems tense today.")[

She asks how your job is going, almost before you've had the chance to (link-reveal:"say hello.")[

You tell her about [[the new role and responsibilities.->Day 5.1 friend]]]]](elseif: $day is 6)[(if: $blame is "it could have been your university lecturer friend.")[(set: $friendstatus to "gone")You don't seem able to get hold of your friend. You contact her university, but they say she didn't turn up for her afternoon lectures. Eventually you decide it's a lost cause and [[call it a night.->Night 6]]](else:)[(if: $code is true)[(set: $friend to it + 1)She has suggested a (link-reveal:"quieter bar than normal.")[

When you walk through the door the handful of other patrons turn to stare at you. Your friend tells them it's ok, and they [[turn away.->Day 6.1 drink]]]](else:)[(set: $friendstatus to "gone")You meet in your usual bar, but your friend feels a little (link-reveal:"standoffish.")[

She tells you that there's a busy period coming up at university, with a lot of essays to be marked. It may not be possible to (link-reveal:"meet up for a little while.")[

She finishes her drink and makes her excuses when you're (link-reveal:"barely halfway through yours.")[

As you walk home it seems to you like [[there are more police cars out patrolling.->Night 6]]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 7)[(if: $code is true)[(set: $friend to it + 1)You've arranged to meet at the bar separately. Your friend is becoming concerned that someone is following her when she (link-reveal:"leaves the university.")[

You arrive first. The other patrons of the bar (link-reveal:"keep themselves to themselves.")[

Eventually [[your friend arrives.->Day 7.1 friend]]]]](else:)[(set: $friendstatus to "gone")You meet in your usual bar, but your friend feels a little (link-reveal:"standoffish.")[

She tells you that there's a busy period coming up at university, with a lot of essays to be marked. It may not be possible to (link-reveal:"meet up for a little while.")[

She finishes her drink and makes her excuses when you're (link-reveal:"barely halfway through yours.")[

As you walk home it seems to you like [[there are more police cars out patrolling.->Next day]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 8)[(if:$code is true)[(set: $friend to it + 1)The bar your friend has suggested appears to be closed. (if: $friendstatus is "known")[It's the resistance bar you've met in before.] You (link-reveal:"keep walking past it.")[

Someone [[whispers your name.->Day 8.1 friend]]]](else:)[(set: $friendstatus to "gone")You meet in your usual bar, but your friend feels a little (link-reveal:"standoffish.")[

She tells you that there's a busy period coming up at university, with a lot of essays to be marked. It may not be possible to (link-reveal:"meet up for a little while.")[

She finishes her drink and makes her excuses when you're (link-reveal:"barely halfway through yours.")[

As you walk home it seems to you like [[there are more police cars out patrolling.->Night 8]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 9)[You try to contact your friend, but don't seem to be able to get in touch.

(if: $friendstatus is "known")[You spend the evening panicking, wondering if she's deep in hiding or if she's been picked up by the police as a dissident.](else:)[Perhaps she's tied up at university, or marking essays and doesn't want to be disturbed.]

Eventually you stop trying and pour yourself a large drink(if: $friendstatus is "known")[ to calm your nerves]. It goes [[straight to your head.->Next day]]]
(else:)[ ]

passages.name: listen to the radio
passages.text:
(if: $day is 1)[An engrossing serial detailing the lives and loves of a wealthy family through decades of war and change (link-reveal:"comes to a head tonight.")[

You listen rapt while the paterfamilias decries the excesses of youth, remembering how just a few short episodes ago his own father railed at him in (link-reveal:"just the same way.")[

After the serial ends come (link-reveal:"the ads.")[

(color:#E88666)[//Can't beat the winter blues? You $word2 with Dopraxycaine.//]

(if:$word2 is "can")[You wrinkle your nose. Must have missed that one.](else:)[Your handiwork is broadcast for the nation to hear.]

Then comes [[the news->Day 1.1 radio]].]]]](elseif: $day is 2)[A new ongoing serial has (link-reveal:"recently started.")[

A rural community has been surprised by a family of immigrants moving into the village. Originally suspicious of the newcomers' ways, the villagers are (link-reveal:"starting to thaw.")[

Tonight the grandmother of the new family learns how to make some traditional dishes, then wows the village with (link-reveal:"her own fusion take on them.")[

You make yourself a cup of cocoa while the ads are on, only turning the volume back up for [[the news->Day 2.1 radio]].]]]](elseif: $day is 3)[In the ongoing serial, the immigrant family have adjusted to their new community and are starting to become the hub around which (link-reveal:"the social calendar revolves.")[

Whether it's giving impromptu cookery classes, leading a traditional dance troupe or a charity drive, there's nowhere the family aren't (link-reveal:"at the centre of things.")[

[[Then come the ads->radio 3.1]]]]](elseif: $day is 4)[In the ongoing serial the immigrant family are targeted for abuse. The rest of the villagers, once hostile themselves, rally around the family and (link-reveal:"hound the abusers out.")[

During the ad break you hear one that crossed your desk:

(color:#E88666)[//Know your neighbours. Good neighbours mean good communities.//]

(if: $word4 is "Reject ad entirely")[Your boss must have overridden your rejection of the ad.] You idly wonder what you're meant to do if you have bad neighbours, then [[the news starts.->radio 4.1]]]](elseif: $day is 5)[In the ongoing serial the immigrant family are joined by a new relative. It quickly becomes apparent that this is in fact someone on the run (link-reveal:"from the authorities.")[

The other villagers lead the police on a merry dance as they (link-reveal:"help the well-meaning stranger.")[

When the ads start it's strange (link-reveal:"not to hear one you've worked on.")[

[[But then the news starts.->radio 5.1]]]]]](elseif: $day is 6)[In the ongoing serial the police are still hunting for the illegal immigrant and the villagers are still (link-reveal:"hiding him.")[

He reveals himself to be a concert pianist and wows the village with an impromptu performance in the village hall. Halfway through (link-reveal:"the police arrive")[, but the village elders distract them while the immigrant is hidden and replaced by the (link-reveal:"five year-old daughter of one of the farmers.")[ She plays a cacophonous Chopsticks much to the policemen's confusion.

After the ads, [[the news begins.->Day 6.1 radio]]]]]](elseif: $day is 7)[In the ongoing serial, the immigrant family is (link-reveal:"in trouble.")[

They've been forced into hiding to escape detention. They're moving between sympathetic villagers' (link-reveal:"houses and barns.")[

But someone in the village has (link-reveal:"tipped off the authorities.")[

Feeling the noose tightening, the immigrant family, who are privvy to so many villagers' secrets, try to do a nice thing for (link-reveal:"everyone who has sheltered them.")[ And (link-reveal:"even those who haven't.")[

They bake cakes, fix roofs, patch up friendships and leave anonymous love notes. The episode ends with the village coming together for a final valiant standoff against an (link-reveal:"increasingly militarised police.")[

Then it's time for [[the news.->Day 7.1 radio]]]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 8)[The ongoing serial is coming to a head tonight. The immigrant family has been (link-reveal:"rounded up by the police.")[

The villagers came together as one and bravely forced them (link-reveal:"out of hiding.")[

Under intense questioning by the police, the family reveal themselves to be foreign agents who had been (link-reveal:"helping to plan a coup.")[

The actors seem underwhelmed by the script, which it sounds like they've been given only (link-reveal:"moments before going on air.")[

Then, after the ads, comes [[the news.->Day 8.1 radio]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 9)[There's a new serial (link-reveal:"starting tonight.")[

It promises to be a historical epic, taking in one of the most crucial moments of the nation's history, when they stood alone against (link-reveal:"invading forces.")[

The first episode centres on a young farmer before the war. By the end he has joined the army and (link-reveal:"war is looming.")[

You make a cup of tea [[before the news starts.->Day 9.1 radio]]]]]]

passages.text:
(if: $day is 1)[You consult your bookshelf then select...

[[Ten Minutes To The Moon->Reading result]] - A trio of astronauts triumph over adversity to reach the moon.

[[The Cuckoo's Song->Reading result]] - A spy in the heart of a corrupt government must complete his mission. Whatever the cost.

[[Learning To Let Go->Reading result]] - A young wife finds that her husband is not everything she thought he was, and must start again just when she thought she had everything figured out.](elseif: $day is 2)[You consult your bookshelf then select...

[[The Inspector Speaks->Reading result]] - The final in a long-running police procedural series. The Inspector, tired after witnessing years of corruption, takes a stand and will either clean the whole department up or be forcibly silenced.

[[A Clutch Of Pearls->Reading result]] - A collection of short stories by notable female writers, offering a wide ranging and witty critique of modern gender mores.

[[Life On The Lam->Reading result]] - Two teenagers kill their abusive father, but when the police don't believe them they escape custody and move from town to town, always one step ahead of the law.](elseif: $day is 3)[You consult your bookshelf then select...

[[A Town Called Palace->Reading result]] - In the far future the ruling class have palaces so large they are effectively self-contained cities. When a scullery maid and cook start to question the system they are forced on the run. But what secrets will they uncover?

[[A Calling-on Song->Reading result]] - A young man questioning his place in the world is besieged by dreams of folk stories. But when one of the folk characters reaches out of the dream and into reality he must come face to face with the truth about the world and himself.

[[A Day To Dread->Reading result]] - It should be the best day of her life. But instead a wedding becomes a fiasco, as first the venue cancels, and then the fiancee is found to be cheating. With nothing to lose it's time to tell it like it is and learn to love again.](elseif: $day is 4)[You consult your bookshelf then select...

[[Bitter Friday->Reading result]] - The final day before the summer holidays and Carson will be taking home a bad report card. He has just one day to try and right the wrongs of the last school year, but can he? And more importantly, does he want to?

[[Seven Swans->Reading result]] - A semi-autobiographical trip through China, stopping off at seven notable sites where the author imagines love affairs set against the grand backdrop of history.

[[Deceit Unbound->Reading result]] - A story of corruption at the heart of a government, with one low-level employee the only man who can bring a regime to its knees and help save the soul of the country.](elseif: $day is 5)[You consult your bookshelf then select...

[[A Cure For Sickness->Reading result]] - A ripping yarn following a snake oil salesman through the Old West as he relies on his quick tongue to best some of the most famous gunfighters of the day.

[[A World Above, A World Below->Reading result]] - A young woman finds herself stranded in India as myths and legends come to life. Can she find her way out, and will she want to?

[[Teaching Teacher To Teach->Reading result]] - A humourous exploration of the trials and frustrations of becoming a teacher. An idealistic young graduate has his eyes opened. Will the bueaurocracy crush his spirit, or will that be the fault of Class C?](elseif: $day is 6)[The local library has closed, so your formerly sagging bookshelf is looking a little light. Tonight it's a choice between...

[[Dearest Audience->Reading result]] - The stage memoir of one of the country's most respected actors is told in a narrative form. From humble beginnings to alcohol-fuelled affairs with prominent men and women, every detail is handsomely told.

[[The Wall->Reading result]] - An allegorical sci-fi novel about a spacefaring race that decides to cut itself off from other planets. When they start building The Wall, a shell around their entire planet, tensions flare.](elseif: $day is 7)[With the local library now closed you've only got a couple of books to chose from...

[[All The World->Reading result]] - On her deathbed an elderly woman recounts stories of her adventures, interspersed with glimpses of a formerly permissive society crumbling into xenophobia.

[[A Handful Of Dynamite->Reading result]] - Frustrated by the excesses of corrupt media barons, three downtrodden friends embark on a thrilling series of attacks against lying newspapers and television networks.](elseif: $day is 8)[You consult your bookshelf then select...

[[Up The Anti->Reading result]] - An undercover cop must infiltrate a terrorist organisation that styles itself as anti-facist. With his cover story in tatters and the terrorists plotting a coup, can he stop them in time?

[[A Love Supreme->Reading result]] - set against the backdrop of a historical war, a grieving widow allows an injured soldier to recuperate in her house. Feelings begin to stir, but when she finds he is an enemy soldier who has simply stolen a friendly uniform, she must place her love for her country above anything else.](elseif: $day is 9)[You consult your bookshelf then select...

[[The Flag->Reading result]] - Terrorists strike at the heart of the government. The only man who can stop them is the President, a former soldier who happens to keep a small arsenal in his office. But it's one man against a tide of evil. How long can he hold out?

[[Hurricance->Reading result]] - A storm is coming. But for one woman it's worse than high winds and torrential rain. Living alone in an isolated village, a schoolteacher becomes the only witness to an invading force. Can she get word to the authorities before it is too late? The storm is closing in and time is running out.]
(else:)[ ]

(set:$reading to it +1)

passages.name: have an early night
passages.text:
(if: $day is 1)[Despite all the coffee today, you find yourself in need of an early night. Anything else can (link-reveal:"keep for another day.")[

You dream of wheat fields, pancakes and an old wooden chair.

Hopefully you'll [[wake up refreshed.->Next day]]]](elseif: $day is 2)[You find your work mentally draining, so after a rudimentary dinner you (link-reveal:"hit the sack.")[

You dream of a lighthouse, threadbare socks and a terrifying maths teacher from your first school.

Hopefully you'll [[wake up refreshed.->Next day]]]](elseif: $day is 3)[You make yourself a cup of cocoa and settle down to sleep (link-reveal:"nice and early.")[

Halfway through a dream about someone holding a wagon wheel on a snowy roof, (link-reveal:"you stir.")[

There's movement (link-reveal:"in the building.")[

Down the hall a door is knocked on. There's a muffled shout. But it (link-reveal:"seems very far off.")[

In the morning you wonder if you [[dreamt it after all.->Next day]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 4)[(if:$protest is false)[You're not in the mood for much tonight, and after rustling up a quick bite to eat (link-reveal:"decide to call it a night.")[

You dream of a road leading off into the distance, a lurking shadow and a cup of coffee that never seems to empty.

Hopefully you'll [[wake up refreshed.->Next day]]]](else:)[(if: $dissident is false)[After the excitement of the protest you're too antsy to do much this evening. You try to sleep, but keep thinking about the sound of chanting (link-reveal:"turning into screams.")[

When you do eventually sleep you dream of thunderstorms, a field of cows and marching automatons.

Hopefully you'll [[wake up refreshed->Next day]]]](else:)[After the excitement of the protest you're too antsy to do much this evening. You try to sleep, but your head (link-reveal:"hurts too much.")[

After the judicious application of whisky and painkillers (link-reveal:"sleep comes a little easier.")[

You dream of a guillotine, cheering crowds and a jewelled throne.

Hopefully your head won't hurt [[in the morning.->Next day]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 5)[The new responsibilities have left you feeling drained. You sip some warm cocoa and (link-reveal:"drift off.")[

You dream of a skyscraper being constructed, a flag waving gently in the breeze and a dark, dark tunnel.

Hopefully you'll [[wake up feeling refreshed.->Next day]]]](elseif: $day is 6)[You sleep fitfully, overthinking (link-reveal:"the day's events.")[

Regardless, you would have been woken up anyway by (link-reveal:"the sound of boots in the hallway.")[

They carry on right past your door. You hear splintering elsewhere in the building. Shouting. Crying. Then the boots thud past the other way and (link-reveal:"all is silent again.")[

When you do snatch some sleep it is [[light and dreamless.->Next day]]]]]](elseif: $day is 7)[(if: $code2 is true)[Sleep doesn't come easily now. You're always waiting for that knock on the door.](else:)[Sleep doesn't come easily now. Icy fingers of dread claw at you in the small hours.] Regardless, eventually you manage to snatch a (link-reveal:"few hours sleep.")[

You dream of an endless road stretching into the distance, a shadow chasing you down a narrow corridor, and fanged beasts swooping overhead.

You hope you'll feel a little refreshed [[in the morning.->Next day]]]](elseif: $day is 8)[(if:$dissident is true)[You fall asleep quickly (link-reveal:"for once.")[

During the night you're woken up by (link-reveal:"the sound of boots in the hallway.")[

They come to a stop (link-reveal:"outside your door.")[

Your front door (link-reveal:"splinters.")[

People are inside your apartment, shouting about (link-reveal:"the police.")[

A flashlight blinds you.

(live:2s)[Hands grab you.](stop:)

(live:4s)[Something smashes into the side of your head.](stop:)

(live:6.5s)[(Goto: "Suspect dissident")](stop:)]]]]]](else:)[You fall asleep quickly (link-reveal:"for once.")[

During the night you're woken up by (link-reveal:"the sound of boots in the hallway.")[

They carry on right past your door. You hear splintering elsewhere in the building. Shouting. Crying. Then the boots thud past the other way and (link-reveal:"all is silent again.")[

When you get back to sleep it is [[light and dreamless.->Next day]]]]]]](elseif: $day is 9)[(if: $code3 is true)[Sleep doesn't come easily tonight. You find yourself thinking about the resistance, about there being only (link-reveal:"one more communication.")[

Maybe you'll be able to sleep properly once it's (link-reveal:"all done.")[

Early in the morning you hear boots in the hallway (link-reveal:"again.")[

You (link-reveal:"hold your breath.")[ They go right past your door. Eventually you sleep. You dream of being [[dragged away.->Next day]]]]]]](else:)[You fall asleep quickly. You're in the middle of a dream about a large apple pie when you're woken by boots in the hallway (link-reveal:"again.")[

They go right past your door and (link-reveal:"carry on.")[

You fall back asleep easily, but [[can't quite get back to the dream about the pie.->Next day]]]]]]
(else:)[ ]

Background to first day
passages.text:
The train is [more quiet]<next| than usual on the way to work.

(click: ?next)[The election results won't be known until (link-reveal:"later in the day.")[

The speculation in the papers is that there will be a (link-reveal:"new government.")[

Maybe they will be able to (link-reveal:"fix the job market.")[

You've never paid that much attention to politics yourself because (set: $politicalview to "you have always got on ok")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["you have always got on ok", "you find it boring", "they are all as bad as each other", "nothing ever really changes"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$politicalview");'>$politicalview</tw-link></mark>.

passages.text:
At work you pour yourself some acrid coffee and (link-reveal:"sit down at your desk.")[

A memo from your boss is on top of (link-reveal:"your papers.")[

//(Color:black)[Political ads still not allowed.]//

You (link-reveal:"shake your head.")[

Following the election there have been protests (link-reveal:"every day.")[

As a result, the Advertising Corrections Team has been ordered to extend the moritorium on political advertising until the government deems the situation (link-reveal:"calmed enough.")[

It just means [[more work to do.->Day 2 Work]]]]]]]

Journey to 3
passages.text:
The train is only one minute late today, the (link-reveal:"best it's been all year.")[

Two police officers are (link-reveal:"stationed on the platform.")[

It's a new mandate from (link-reveal:"the government.")[

Alongside their ban on unsanctioned gatherings of large groups, they have (link-reveal:"increased visible policing.")[

Their presence makes you feel (set: $policeview to "safe")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["safe", "nervous"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$policeview");'>$policeview</tw-link></mark>.

At least there hasn't been a repeat of the violent protests (link-reveal:"since the new laws.")[

The man with the combover is with a much younger woman. You [[spend the journey->New rule 2]] trying to decide if she's a lover or a daughter.]]]]]

passages.name: Journey to 4
passages.text:
The train is (link-reveal:"on time today.")[(link-reveal:" Almost.")[

The two brothers who spend every journey whispering to each other are particularly energetic today, one of them gesticulating wildly while the other (link-reveal:"stifles laughter.")[ (if: $suspicion is >= 30)[Perhaps it's your imagination but they seem to glance over at you more frequently than at other people.]

When you arrive at the station there's a queue to get (link-reveal:"through the barriers.")[

In front of you (link-reveal:"the combover man checks his watch and tuts.")[

As well as tickets, papers are (link-reveal:"being checked at the barriers.")[

You show your government employee card and are [[waved through.->Day 4 Work]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey to 5
passages.text:
The train is (link-reveal:"on time.")[

You almost don't have time to buy a newspaper before boarding but (link-reveal:"just about manage it.")[

The headline is a takedown of the president's (link-reveal:"flagship immigration policy.")[

It accuses him of lying in no uncertain terms, and calls for (link-reveal:"other papers to follow suit.")[

You glance around the carriage at other front pages and see (link-reveal:"similar headlines.")[

When you get off the train you have your ID (link-reveal:"ready for the checks.")[

But there's [[even more of a queue today.->Journey to 5.1]]]]]]]]

links.text: even more of a queue today.

passages.name: Journey to 6
passages.text:
You pick up a copy of the paper before (link-reveal:"getting on to the train.")[ Which is (link-reveal:"on time.")[

The paper carries a headline (link-reveal:"you helped rewrite.")[ You feel (set: $headlinereaction to "proud")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["proud", "ambivalent", "numb", "nauseated"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$headlinereaction");'>$headlinereaction</tw-link></mark>. Once ensconced in your usual seat, you (link-reveal:"open the paper.")[

An envelope falls out.

(if:$codewarning is true)[You've been waiting for something like this since (link-reveal:"that night in the bar.")[You...

[[Open the envelope.->Journey to 6.1a]]

[[Pocket the envelope->Journey to 6.1b]]]](else:)[You...

[[Open the envelope.->Journey to 6.1a]]

[[Pocket the envelope->Journey to 6.1b]]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey to 7
passages.text:
The train is (link-reveal:"on time again this morning.")[

(if: $code is true)[Inside your paper is (link-reveal:"another envelope.")[

It's the (link-reveal:"fourth in a row.")[

You [[open it carefully.->Journey to 7 Code]]]]]
(else:)[(if: $blame is "it could have been the lady from the train.")[There's still no sign of the smartly dressed clumsy lady. You try not to think too hard about where she might be.] You glance through the stories in the paper, but they're all (link-reveal:"familiar to you now.")[

The sanctions against persons from countries deemed a negative cultural influence have been (link-reveal:"ramped up.")[ The newspaper is very clear about how necessary this is for (link-reveal:"national security.")[

The story about theatre director Harmony Yates seeking asylum in Germany had to be (link-reveal:"removed entirely.")[

You enjoy rereading the match report on the back page, and [[the journey flies by.->Day 7 Work]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey to 8
passages.text:
The train is (link-reveal:"on time again today.")[

You buy a newspaper (link-reveal:"out of habit still.")[

It's nice to have something to (link-reveal:"hide behind.")[

(if:$code is true)[And besides, how else would the resistance (link-reveal:"contact you?")[ But there's no envelope.]] Only one of the |brothers>[two brothers] is on the train today.

(click: ?brothers)[You wonder what's happened to (link-reveal:"the other one.")[

(link-reveal:"Illness?")[
(link-reveal:"Changed jobs?")[
(link-reveal:"Moved away?")[
Or (if: $blame is "it could have been the lady from the train.")[the same thing that happened to the clumsy lady?](else:)[something altogether worse?]

The remaining brother looks around the carriage for the whole journey, like he's (link-reveal:"searching for someone.")[

You wonder if //he// even knows [[what's happened to his brother.->New rule 4]]]]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey to 9
passages.text:
Neither of the brothers are on the train (link-reveal:"this morning.")[

The combover man seems to have his head held (link-reveal:"slightly higher than usual.")[

(if: $suspicion is >= 60)[He gives you a strange smirk, then gets back to his book.](else:)[He gives you a slight head nod, then gets back to his book.] You can't see the book title, but the cover has an image of (link-reveal:"flags and tanks.")[

(if: $code is true)[An envelope is waiting for you in your newspaper. [[You open it.->Journey to 9.1]]](else:)[You skim through the news without taking any of it in. Eventually you (text-style:"blur")[[[doze off.->Day 9 Work]]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey to 10
passages.text:
(if: $code3 is true)[You can't concentrate (link-reveal:"on the way to work.")[

The carriage is three quarters full. You steal glances, wondering if anyone else knows about (link-reveal:"the resistance's plans.")[

The combover man has his newspaper spread wide, into the personal space of (link-reveal:"the people either side.")[

A woman a few seats along is reading a book and chuckles out loud (link-reveal:"every few minutes.")[

At the station you keep expecting guards to stop you at the gates, but (link-reveal:"no-one does.")[

You wonder if anyone will leave your office at 10am. [[You wonder if you will.->Day 10 Work]]]]]]]](else:)[The train is (link-reveal:"on time again.")[

The carriage is about (link-reveal:"three quarters full.")[

The combover man has his newspaper spread wide, into the personal space of (link-reveal:"the people either side.")[

A woman a few seats along is reading a book and chuckles out loud (link-reveal:"every few minutes.")[

You fall asleep, waking up just in time to [[dash off the train.->Day 10 Work]]]]]]]

passages.name: New rule 2
passages.text:
You pour a large coffee before even looking at the (link-reveal:"stack of paperwork on your desk.")[

Work has become (link-reveal:"increasingly busy.")[

As well as tightening up policing, the government has introduced a (link-reveal:"new advertising rule.")[

In order to stimulate the economy, and as a sanction against meddling foreign powers, [[advertising of products from certain foreign countries has been banned.->New rule 2.1]]]]]

passages.text:
On the (link-reveal:"train home")[ (more than ten minutes late)] the man with the combover is (link-reveal:"with the young woman again.")[

It becomes abundantly clear (link-reveal:"they are lovers.")[

You start imagining (link-reveal:"his life.")[
(link-reveal:"His incredible sense of humour.")[
(link-reveal:"His fortune made on the stock market.")[
(link-reveal:"His youth as an avant garde musician.")[
Or whatever else it may be that has attracted the young lady (link-reveal:"to him.")[

Then he notices (link-reveal:"someone staring.")[

Not you, thank god, but (link-reveal:"a man three seats down from you.")[

The combover man stands and (link-reveal:"starts yelling.")[

(color:#E88666)[What's your problem? Got (link-reveal:"something you want to say?")[ You come over here and take money out of the pockets of our workers. But that's (link-reveal:"not enough.")[ You want (link-reveal:"our women too.")[ You (link-reveal:"darkie bastard.")[

(color:#7DBCFF)[Other people are staring over their newspapers. The target of the combover man's ire is staring at his shoes. (link-reveal:"You...")[

[Bury your head in your paper]<option1|

[Intervene]<option2|

(click: ?option1)[(set: $stepin to false)(goto:"Journey from 3.1")]
(click: ?option2)[(set: $stepin to true)(goto:"Journey from 3.1")]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey from 3.1
passages.text:
(if: $stepin is true)[(set: $suspicion to it +10)You stand up and tell the combover man (link-reveal:"to shut up.")[

He splutters and turns an interesting (link-reveal:"shade of pink.")[

His ladyfriend (link-reveal:"looks daggers at you.")[

But they alight (link-reveal:"at the next stop.")[

And the man he had been shouting at (link-reveal:"whispers a thank you.")[

Everyone goes back to //actually// (link-reveal:"reading their papers.")[

And finally the train pulls in at [[your station.->Home Hub]]]]]]]]]
(else:)[The man rants for a full five minutes, blaming the man, and immigrants in general, for everything from the economy to (link-reveal:"the performance of his favourite team.")[

No-one else says (link-reveal:"a word.")[

At the next stop the combover man and his girlfriend alight, and everyone goes back to //actually// [[reading their papers.->Home Hub]]]]]

passages.name: Day 4 Work
passages.text:
When you reach the office everyone is discussing (link-reveal:"the ID checks.")[

Your boss announces that it's part of a new crackdown on (link-reveal:"illegal immigrants.")[ And due to certain foreign powers stoking undesirable sentiment a number of new countries have been added to the (link-reveal:"Sanction List.")[

Products or organisations from France, Germany, Belgium and Spain (link-reveal:"may no longer advertise.")[

You sigh. More rules, [[more work.->Day 4 Work 2]]]]]]

passages.text:
At the station near your office a small crowd has gathered (link-reveal:"by the ticket barriers.")[

Banners read //We Won't Be Disappeared// and //President of Lies//. You have to go through the crowd to get to your train, and as you do, one of the protesters (link-reveal:"tries to stop you.")[

(color:#E88666)[The immigrants are being rounded up,] he says. (color:#E88666)[Anyone without papers is being (link-reveal:"taken to a detention centre.")[ Won't you join us and make a stand?

(color:#7DBCFF)[You look around the station. The crowd definitely exceeds the size allowed by the new law. Two police officers are watching, but have not intervened yet. (link-reveal:"You...")[

[[Hang around the edge of the protest.]]

[[Pick up a placard and join in the chanting.]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey to 5.1
passages.text:
As you approach the barriers you see large bins have been placed on either side. Two police officers are ordering commuters to (link-reveal:"place their newspapers in the bins.")[

Three people ahead of you, the man with the combover (link-reveal:"lobs his in.")[

Behind him, the woman who usually drops hers (link-reveal:"tries to hold on to it for once.")[

One of the police officers (link-reveal:"raises his baton.")[ She places her paper in the bin. The other officer scribbles something in his notebook and watches her (link-reveal:"leave the station.")[

There's one person, a burly man, betwen you and the police. You (set: $paper to "prepare to hand your paper over")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["prepare to hand your paper over", "try to stuff the paper under your clothes quickly"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$paper");'>$paper</tw-link></mark>.

The man in front of you hands his paper over without a second thought. [[Your turn.->Journey to 5.2]]]]]]]

passages.name: Day 5 Work
passages.text:
Your boss is waiting by your desk when you (link-reveal:"finally arrive at work.")[

You start to apologise for your lateness but (link-reveal:"he waves you quiet.")[

(color:#E88666)[We've been given a new responsibility.] He licks his lips nervously. (color:#E88666)[As you're no doubt aware, the news media has been (link-reveal:"lying about the president.")[ As a consequence, the Advertising Corrections Team is, as of today, the (link-reveal:"News And Advertising Corrections Team.")[

//Battle for the Stars Novel Synopsis

In the far future space travel has become normal. Galaxies have been explored and other life forms discovered. But when Crag Bagly discovers (set: $word1 to "the government of Earth")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["the government of Earth", "the alien governments are"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word1");'>$word1</tw-link></mark> harbouring a powerful secret, he must (set: $word2 to "choose between his planet and his morality.")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["choose between his planet and his morality.", "take the fight to the stars."]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word2");'>$word2</tw-link></mark>

Together with a ragtag group of (set: $word3 to "aliens from across the universe")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["aliens from across the universe", "human allies"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word3");'>$word3</tw-link></mark>, it's time to rise against (set: $word4 to "the corrupt government")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["the corrupt government", "hostile aliens"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word4");'>$word4</tw-link></mark> before it's too late.//

//The Bleeding Heart Novel Synopsis

A young mother finds an illegal immigrant hiding in her garden shed. On the run from the police, he makes an impassioned plea to stay. With her (set: $word5 to "abusive")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["abusive", "hardworking"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word5");'>$word5</tw-link></mark> husband away on business, the young mother's (set: $word6 to "passions are inflamed.")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["passions are inflamed.", "judgement is clouded."]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word6");'>$word6</tw-link></mark>

Two weeks later the husband returns and finds an empty house. (set: $word7 to "His wife has taken his child and fled with her immigrant lover")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["His wife has taken his child and fled with her immigrant lover", "His wife and child have been kidnapped by the immigrant"]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word7");'>$word7</tw-link></mark>, leaving nothing but broken crockery to symbolise the violence (set: $word8 to "he has perpetrated on his wife.")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["he has perpetrated on his wife.", "the immigrant has brought into this peaceful home."]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word8");'>$word8</tw-link></mark>//

//The Herrawyn Chronicles: Book V Novel Synopsis

Herrawyn has gone from scullery maid to warrior-priestess over the preceding books. She is now a figure of authority and widely respected.

When the ruling conclave, a male-led council, declares that women can no longer be warriors or enter the priesthood, Herrawyn (set: $word9 to "leads an uprising to teach the patriarchy what being a warrior truly means.")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["leads an uprising to teach the patriarchy what being a warrior truly means.", "flees overseas before leading an invading force to take the throne.", "dutifully submits, trusting the rulers to know what is best.", "pretends to submit while organising a secret resistance."]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word9");'>$word9</tw-link></mark>

Along the way (set: $word10 to "her tryst with Daclenn continues, but she starts to feel lusty stirrings towards former villain Morgryrr and also her former travelling companion Boudicette.")<mark><tw-link class='cyclingLink' data-cycling-texts='["her tryst with Daclenn continues, but she starts to feel lusty stirrings towards former villain Morgryrr and also her former travelling companion Boudicette.", "her tryst with Daclenn ends in blood. Together, the three scandalise the staid nation.", "her relationship with Daclenn continues."]' onclick='clickCyclingLink(this, "$word10");'>$word10</tw-link></mark>//

You've read the previous Herrawyn books and have been eagerly awaiting the fifth. As your pen hovers over the pages you find yourself swept up by the intrigue and romance. Part of you wants to (link-reveal:"push it even further.")[

//(color:black)[Presidential approval rating at all time high.]//

passages.text:
He looks around the bar, sees you by yourself and (link-reveal:"rushes over to join you.")[

The barman gives him a slight nod, but you've (link-reveal:"never seen him before.")[

(color:#E88666)[I'm sorry.] His voice is rasping, as if he's been (link-reveal:"shouting all day.")[

Now he's close you can see he has the beginnings of (link-reveal:"a black eye.")[

(color:#E88666)[Just pretend you know me, please.] He leans back and grabs an empty glass from a vacant table, setting it in front of himself as if he's (link-reveal:"been there for a while.")[

You ask him...

[[...what's going on?->Day 2.2 drink]]

[[...to leave.->Day 2.2 drink]]

[[...nothing.->Day 2.2 drink]]]]]]]

passages.name: Day 2.2 drink
passages.text:
Before he can say anything, three more people (link-reveal:"rush into the bar.")[

They aren't wearing uniforms, but they carry themselves with (link-reveal:"an air of authority.")[

Two look around the bar, starting from the back. The third (link-reveal:"approaches the barman.")[

(color:#E88666)[Someone just come in here?] The barman (link-reveal:"shakes his head.")[

(color:#E88666)[Answer me properly.] The barman (link-reveal:"mutters something.")[

The man (link-reveal:"rejoins his comrades.")[

They approach every table in turn, finally (link-reveal:"reaching yours.")[

The young man next to you leans his head into his hand to try to (link-reveal:"hide the eye swelling.")[

One of the men looks you (link-reveal:"up and down.")[ 

(color:#E88666)[Someone come running in here? Alone?] He (link-reveal:"glances at the young man.")[


You say...

[[Yes.]]

[[No.]]

[[Nothing.]]]]]]]]]]]]

(color:#E88666)[Thank you.] The leader of the trio gives you (link-reveal:"a smile.")[(color:#E88666)[This bastard was one of the ringleaders at the riot today.] They (link-reveal:"take him away.")[

The barman doesn't meet your gaze when you buy (link-reveal:"your next drink.")[

The rest of the evening passes [[without incident.->Next day]]]]]]

passages.text:
(set:$protest to false)You power through to your train, where the combover man looks (link-reveal:"even more indignant than usual.")[

The woman who always drops her paper isn't on the train today, and you wonder if she's busy (link-reveal:"dropping a placard instead.")[

passages.name: Hang around the edge of the protest.
passages.text:
(set: $suspicion to it +10)(set: $protest to true)You loiter near the edge of the protest, not quite brave enough to (link-reveal:"pick up a placard.")[

It's the (link-reveal:"first protest you've ever been on.")[

Some of the chants are (link-reveal:"quite catchy:")[

(color:#E88666)[//Lies, lies, and more lies, he's the prez that we despise.//]

You don't quite have the nerve to (link-reveal:"join in.")[

After ten minutes a few more people have joined, either loitering like you or picking up a placard and (link-reveal:"getting stuck in.")[

You recognise the woman from the train who always drops her paper. She gives you (link-reveal:"a nod.")[

And then [[the police make their move.]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Pick up a placard and join in the chanting.
passages.text:
(set: $suspicion to it +20)(set: $protest to true)(set: $dissident to true)You grab hold of a placard and hoist it high. (if: $protester is true)[The woman handing the placards out looks familiar. She smiles at you and you realise it's the woman with the bloody nose from a few weeks ago.] 

The slogans are pretty catchy, and soon enough (link-reveal:"you're chanting along:")[

//Say it loud, say it clear: immigrants are welcome here.//

//Lies, lies, and more lies, he's the prez that we despise.//

The crowd has (link-reveal:"swelled in size.")[

You recognise the woman from your commute who always drops her paper. She gives you (link-reveal:"a friendly head nod.")[

[[And then the police arrive.]]]]]

passages.name: the police make their move.
passages.text:
The two policemen who had been watching were, it turns out, merely (link-reveal:"waiting for back up.")[

Their colleagues stream into the station (link-reveal:"scattering commuters and passers by.")[

You're on the edge of the protest still, (link-reveal:"close to one of the barriers.")[

As batons meet protesters you race away up the platform and dive on to a train that's (link-reveal:"just about to depart.")[

By pure luck it's (link-reveal:"going to your station.")[

As you catch your breath you realise half the carriage are staring at you. You take a seat and pretend to sleep all the way home, [[pulse racing.->Home Hub]]]]]]]

passages.name: And then the police arrive.
passages.text:
The two policemen who had been watching were, it turns out, merely (link-reveal:"waiting for back up.")[

Their colleagues stream into the station (link-reveal:"scattering commuters and passers by.")[

Within seconds batons are crashing down on the (link-reveal:"front rank of protesters.")[

You're in the middle of the throng, and suddenly a space opens up behind you. You've got a clear run (link-reveal:"to the barriers.")[

You're halfway there when something connects with the back of your head. You stumble, but (link-reveal:"manage to keep your footing.")[

You glance back and see a police officer chasing you, (link-reveal:"lining up another hit.")[

You dive under the ticket barrier, but he hasn't seen it. His momentum carries him into the barrier, (link-reveal:"and he rebounds, winded.")[

You jump on to a train just as the doors are closing. By pure luck it's (link-reveal:"going to your station.")[

As you catch your breath you realise half the carriage are (link-reveal:"staring at you.")[

You take a seat and pretend to sleep. Your head hurts, but isn't bleeding. [[Your pulse is racing.->Home Hub]]]]]]]]]]]

passages.name: radio 4.1
passages.text:
The lead story is about the government's new sanctions against (link-reveal:"undocumented migrants.")[

Their spokesperson is at pains to point out that law-abiding immigrants with their paperwork in order have (link-reveal:"nothing to fear.")[

But when he is challenged on the conditions of the camp where undocumented migrants (link-reveal:"are being sent")[, and on the upsurge in reports of (link-reveal:"racist abuse")[, he simply repeats that law abiding immigrants have (link-reveal:"nothing to fear.")[

There's a brief mention of the (link-reveal:"protest at the station.")[

The presenter reports that the government is blaming foreign agitators, but people who were present (link-reveal:"have contradicted that.")[

The government spokesperson is still in the studio and tries to interrupt, but (link-reveal:"the presenter doesn't let him.")[

(if: $dissident is true)[Your head aches from being hit and you decide it's [[time to call it a night.->Next day]]](else:)[You decide it's [[time to call it a night.->Next day]]]]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Day 4.1 family
passages.text:
After a few false starts and half-finished sentences you manage to (link-reveal:"piece things together.")[

His wife was running an errand earlier. She went out (link-reveal:"with their baby daughter.")[

He received a panicked phone call (link-reveal:"three hours ago.")[

She had been (link-reveal:"arrested.")[

She's from Nigeria originally, but is a citizen here now. She had gone out without any documentation as it was just a quick errand. But the police were in the doctor's waiting room, (link-reveal:"checking everyone's papers.")[

When she couldn't produce ID, she was (link-reveal:"taken away.")[

Her baby was [[taken separately.->4.2 family]]]]]]]]

passages.name: 4.2 family
passages.text:
Eventually she was able to make a phone call and let your brother know (link-reveal:"what was happening.")[

He has been on the phone to the police, the Nigerian embassy and the government all afternoon trying to track them down, (link-reveal:"with limited success.")[

He's expecting a (link-reveal:"call from-")[

There's a knock on his door, mid-sentence. He drops the phone (link-reveal:"with an ear-numbing thud.")[

You hear some kind of (link-reveal:"commotion.")[

After a while (link-reveal:"you hear his voice again.")[

(color:#E88666)[She's back, they're both back, oh my god!]

He hangs up, (link-reveal:"breathless with relief.")[

You pour yourself a stiff drink, then [[call it a night.->Next day]]]]]]]]]

(if: $letter is true)[You reveal that you've received the same kind of letter.

(color:#E88666)[Maybe we shouldn't be seen together,]](else:)[(color:#E88666)[It's not going to change how I behave though. Perhaps you shouldn't be seen with me,]] (link-reveal:"she jokes.")[

(if: $protest is true)[You tell her about the protest you joined earlier and she almost spits out her drink.

(color:#E88666)[I didn't know you had it in you,] she splutters.](else:)[You tell her about the protest you saw earlier.

(color:#E88666)[What will it take,] she asks.]

Across the bar there's a [[sudden commotion.->Day 4.2 friend]]]

passages.name: Day 4.2 friend
passages.text:
A group of men have surrounded the table of (link-reveal:"a black couple.")[

They're (link-reveal:"demanding the table for themselves.")[

(color:#E88666)[Jesus Christ,] your friend says as she stands. (color:#E88666)[Come on.] 

She starts towards the group. (link-reveal:"You...")[

[[Join her.]]

[[Stay seated.]]]]]

passages.text:
(set: $suspicion to it +10)(set: $helpedfriend to true)You follow your friend to (link-reveal:"the group of men.")[

There are (link-reveal:"five of them.")[

Your friend asks them (link-reveal:"what the problem is.")[

(color:#E88666)[We want the table,] one of the men mutters.

You suggest they try one of the empty tables (link-reveal:"dotted round the bar.")[

They (link-reveal:"don't seem keen.")[

Your friend (link-reveal:"stares them down.")[ They're all itching for a fight, but only (link-reveal:"on their terms.")[

They turn and leave, knocking a few glasses off tables as they go to (link-reveal:"save a bit of face.")[

You order (link-reveal:"more drinks.")[

(color:#E88666)[This is only going to get worse, you know,] your friend says.

You nod agreement and then the adrenaline kicks in and you have to down your drink or you'll either (link-reveal:"laugh hysterically or cry.")[

(text-style:"blur")[At some point in the evening there are [[flaming shots.->Next day]]]]]]]]]]]]]

You can't quite hear the exchange, but after a few curt words the group (link-reveal:"turn to leave.")[

They push a few glasses off tables as they go, (link-reveal:"saving a little face.")[

Your friend returns, clearly (link-reveal:"disappointed in you.")[

(color:#E88666)[This is only going to get worse, you know.]

You make smalltalk about a couple of film stars you used to idolise, but (link-reveal:"the atmosphere has soured.")[

When you've both finished your drinks you [[call it a night.->Next day]]]]]]

(if: $paper is "prepare to hand your paper over")[You drop it into the bin and ask (link-reveal:"what's going on.")[

He just shrugs and [[waves you through.->Day 5 Work]]]](else:)[(set: $suspicion to it + 20)You tell him you don't have one, hoping he can't hear (link-reveal:"the rustle under your clothes.")[

He waves you through, but someone shouts out (link-reveal:"from behind you.")[

(color:#E88666)[They've hidden theirs!]

You don't see who shouted it, because instantly the police officers place their hands on your shoulders and (link-reveal:"demand you hand it over.")[

(color:#E88666)[We will strip search you if necessary.] The officer grins as he (link-reveal:"looks you up and down.")[ (color:#E88666)[And not in the nice way.]

You extricate the paper from your clothes and (link-reveal:"place it in the bin.")[

As one of them glances at your ID and scribbles in his notebook, you ask (link-reveal:"why they're doing this.")[

He just shrugs and [[waves you through.->Day 5 Work]]]]]]]]]]

passages.text: Music Awards Ceremony Hots Up This week sees the thirteenth annual Top Ten Awards ceremony, hosted at the National Academy for the Arts. passages.text:
(color:black)[//Hi

By the time you read this we'll be gone. Sorry I couldn't tell you over the phone. I think they've been bugging us. I know that sounds paranoid, but I think that's where we are now. 

We're thinking of our own safety, and the safety of our little girl. I'm sorry you won't get to see her, for a while at least, but this is our only option. I've enclosed a photo.

We've learnt that they're going to come for all the immigrants. Or anyone from their list at any rate. I think they'd take our girl. Can you believe that? Born here, but with an immigrant mum. But they'd take her.

Maybe you don't believe it, maybe you do. You work for them after all, but I hope that doesn't mean you believe everything they tell you.

I won't tell you where we're going. Hopefully we'll make it out. 

I hope one day you'll be able to see your niece again.

I hope you're fighting this.//]

passages.text:
It's your friend, lurking in the shadows of (link-reveal:"an alley.")[

She beckons you over, and leads you through the back door of a shop and down some (link-reveal:"dingy stairs.")[

You find yourself in a dark room that's furnished with a small mattress and a large pile of books (link-reveal:"on the floor.")[

(if: $friendstatus is "unknown")[(set:$friendstatus to "known")She admits that she's part of the resistance and is now on the run. She's the one who has been giving you codes.](else:)[She realised she was under surveillance and has gone into hiding.]

Then she tells you (link-reveal:"the big news.")[

The resistance is planning a major protest. It might even be (link-reveal:"an uprising.")[

There will be a code (link-reveal:"tomorrow.")[ It's imperative you get it (link-reveal:"into a paper.")[

You explain you've been moved on to books, but she tells you (link-reveal:"not to worry.")[ The right piece (link-reveal:"will find your desk.")[

You spend a few more minutes catching up and asking about the resistance, but your friend is (link-reveal:"clearly shattered.")[

You walk home keeping an eye out for anyone following you, but you [[seem to be clear.->Night 8]]]]]]]]]]]](set: $suspectboss to true)

passages.name: Day 8.1 drink
passages.text:
(color:black)[Did you see someone run this way? What did they look like?]

You reply...

[[Yes, a tall woman with brown hair.->Day 8.2 drink]]

[[No, didn't see anything.->Day 8.2 drink]]

[[Yes, a stocky blonde man.->Day 8.2 drink]]

links.text: Yes, a tall woman with brown hair.

passages.name: Day 8.2 drink
passages.text:
He rejoins his comrades and (link-reveal:"disappears from view.")[

The rest of the evening passes (link-reveal:"without incident.")[

On your way home you find yourself wondering (link-reveal:"if they ever caught her.")[ And if what she'd done [[really matters.->Night 8]]]]]

links.text: They stare at what you've written.

passages.text:
{(if: $fuck is 5)[(color:#76FF70)[Ah, we have a rebellious spirit here. That's a shame. That's a real shame. Your colleagues have been ever so much more helpful.]]
(elseif: $blank is 5)[(color:#76FF70)[You don't know anyone, eh? Pure as driven snow, all your acquaintances? All your family? Your colleagues have been ever so much more perceptive, ever so much more helpful.]]
(elseif: $fuck + $blank is 5)[(color:#76FF70)[Ah, we have a rebellious spirit here. That's a shame. That's a real shame. Your colleagues have been ever so much more helpful.]]
(else:)[(if: $family is > 0 and $name1 is "Your brother and his wife")[(set: $namednames to true)(color:#76FF70)[Ah, the brother?]]
(if: $friend is > 0 and $name2 is "Your university lecturer friend")[(set:$namednames to true)(color:#76FF70)[The friend? Interesting.]]
(if: $protest is true and $name3 is "The clumsy lady from the train")[(set: $namednames to true)(color:#76FF70)[Ha, I think we know this woman from your commute, yes.]]
(if: $bar is true and $name4 is "The patrons of the resistance bar")[(set: $namednames to true)(color:#76FF70)[A whole nest of troublemakers, hmm?]]
(if: $suspectboss is true and $name5 is "Your boss")[(set: $namednames to true)(color:#76FF70)[The head of your department? That is troubling. Troubling indeed.]]]
(if: $name1 is "Fuck you" or $name2 is "Fuck you" or $name3 is "Fuck you" or $name4 is "Fuck you" or $name5 is "Fuck you") [He jabs a finger where you've written the expletive. (color:#76FF70)[But please, do not think your little act of rebellion will not go unpunished.]]}

The two men share a silent look, then take a file from a stack on the table.

(color:#76FF70)[Let's see now,] one of the men says. (color:#76FF70)[What shall we do [[with you?->Sentence.1]]]

passages.name: Journey to 9.1
passages.text:
//(color:black)[Thank you for your continued support. 

A news article will find its way to your desk. Please include the phrase ''fiendishly deceptive''.

This is crucially important, and we hope you will join us. If you do, you will receive only one further communication.]//

You spend the rest of the journey wondering how the news article will find you. [[Who else is working with the resistance?->Day 9 Work]]

passages.name: Day 9 Work code
passages.text: You turn the page over in your hands. Sure enough, (link-reveal:"it's a news article.")[ You raise your head, but can't see anyone acting suspiciously. You pick up your pen and (link-reveal:"get to work.")[ Government Cracks Down On Dissidents In a move described by some pundits as "(set: $word7 to "an Orwellian nightmare")$word7", the government last night moved against a number of people it has labelled as dissidents. Individuals from all around the country have been arrested under (set: $word8 to "harsh")$word8 new anti-terror legislation. Singer Micah Power is one of the highest profile (set: $word9 to "victims of the new law")$word9, her agent has this morning confrmed. The government were not immediately available for comment on where the (set: $word10 to "so-called dissidents")$word10 have been taken, but a statement was eventually provided. A spokesperson said, "To call these arrests anything other than a triumph of law and order over evil and terrorism would be (set: $word11 to "grossly unfair")$word11." When you're happy with the corrections you take another (link-reveal:"look around the office.")[ Nothing seems out of the ordinary. People are talking and laughing as they leave for the day. You [[hand your work in and join them.->Day 9 Results 1]]]]]

passages.name: Journey from 9.1a
passages.text:
She goes flying. The policeman is on her in seconds. He holds her down, knee in the small of her back, as he put (link-reveal:"handcuffs on her.")[

He tips his hat to you as he frogmarches her (link-reveal:"back down the train.")[

The man with the combover (link-reveal:"spits at her.")[

Your blood is pumping fast, but the rest of the journey [[is uneventful.->Home Hub]]]]]

passages.name: Journey from 9.1b
passages.text:
You tuck your legs under the seat as she flies past you. The officer thunders past seconds behind. In moments they're through to another carriage and you doubt you'll ever know (link-reveal:"if she was caught.")[

You stare at the headlines in the paper. Then, (link-reveal:"a few minutes later...")[ The policeman frogmarches the woman, handcuffed, back down the train (link-reveal:"past you.")[

Her knees are bloody. Someone must have tripped her after all. As she passes him, the combover man (link-reveal:"spits at her.")[

Soon enough they're into the previous carriage and out of sight. You spend the rest of the journey staring at the headlines but [[reading nothing.->Home Hub]]]]]]

passages.name: Journey from 9.1c
passages.text:
The woman runs past you. In the seconds it takes the officer to get to you, your leg edges (link-reveal:"into the aisle.")[

He (link-reveal:"trips.")[

He falls flat on his face as the woman is off and (link-reveal:"into the next carriage.")[

He picks himself up, patting at his slightly torn trousers. He stares at you. Hairs prickle (link-reveal:"on the back of your neck.")[

Then he takes off in pursuit again. You doubt you'll ever know if he managed to catch her, and pretend to read your paper for the (link-reveal:"rest of the journey.")[

Occasionally you catch a glimpse of the combover man [[glaring at you.->Home Hub]]]]]]](set:$suspicion to it +15)

passages.name: Day 9.1 radio
passages.text:
There's a new presenter tonight. He launches straight into a story about a number of terrorists being picked up by (link-reveal:"the police.")[

They were lurking in plain site, with figures such as singer Micah Power being (link-reveal:"arrested.")[

He passes on the government's call for people to be vigilant and report any (link-reveal:"suspicious behaviour.")[

The next story is an expose of an influential businessman and CEO of the petcare brand Buddy. He is at the centre of what the government are calling a homosexual conspiracy to undermine the traditional values of the country and (link-reveal:"pervert the nation's youth.")[

The weather tomorrow will be [[dry and sunny.->Next day]]]]]]

passages.name: Resistance letter
passages.text:
//(color:black)[It starts tomorrow.

Go to work as usual. At 10am make your way to City Hall. They have started rounding us up. It's now or never.]//

You burn the letter and [[flush the ashes down the sink.->Home Hub]]

(set: $resistanceletter to true)

links.text: flush the ashes down the sink.

passages.name: Day 9.1 drink
passages.text:
The group are (link-reveal:"instantly welcoming.")[

They all insist on (link-reveal:"buying the drinks.")[

As the beer goes down, they start (link-reveal:"telling stories.")[

They're all local, born and raised in the capital. Most of them have been unemployed (link-reveal:"for a while.")[

When they find out you work for the government they let out a cheer and (link-reveal:"buy shots.")[

(text-style:"blur")[After that things are difficult to decipher]

(text-style:"blurrier")[Somehow you [[make it home.->Next day]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Day 10a
passages.text:
You stand, (link-reveal:"legs trembling.")[

Before you can take a step, the office doors (link-reveal:"burst inwards.")[

Police swarm into the building. They're shouting orders that you can't hear above the blood (link-reveal:"thumping in your ears.")[

Hands (link-reveal:"grab you.")[

You see your co-workers (link-reveal:"being taken away as well.")[

Your boss looks ashen-faced as he is (link-reveal:"marched out.")[

You're bundled (link-reveal:"into a car.")[ A hood is (link-reveal:"shoved over your head.")[

You drive for what [[feels like hours.->Suspect Day 10]]]]]]]]]]

(set: $uprising to true)

passages.text:
The office doors (link-reveal:"burst inwards.")[

Police swarm into the building. They're shouting for everyone to remain calm and (link-reveal:"submit for questioning.")[

Hands (link-reveal:"grab you.")[

You see your co-workers (link-reveal:"being taken away as well.")[

Your boss looks ashen-faced as he is (link-reveal:"marched out.")[

You're bundled (link-reveal:"into a car.")[ A hood is (link-reveal:"shoved over your head.")[

You drive for what [[feels like hours.->Suspect Day 10]]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Suspect Day 10
passages.text:
Finally the car pulls in somewhere, and you're marched (link-reveal:"into a building.")[

When they remove the hood you're in a small windowless room. Two men sit opposite you, wearing cheap suits. Your hands are shackled to the table in front of you. The light is odiously (link-reveal:"tinged with green.")[

Your head (link-reveal:"is spinning.")[

(color:#76FF70)[We thank you in advance for your co-operation.] one of the men (link-reveal:"says.")[

(color:#76FF70)[We have been watching you. You've been trying to avoid suspicion, but we know exactly what you've been getting up to. We could throw you in prison for life. (link-reveal:"Right now.")[

(link-reveal:"Unless...")[ You wish to [[help us with our enquiries.->Naming names]]]]]]]]]

passages.name: Suspect B
passages.text:
You wake up (link-reveal:"gasping for air.")[

Something is (link-reveal:"covering your face.")[

Slowly, the hood (link-reveal:"is removed.")[

Two men sit opposite you, wearing cheap suits. Your hands are shackled to the table in front of you. The light is odiously (link-reveal:"tinged with green.")[

Your head (link-reveal:"really hurts.")[

(color:#76FF70)[We thank you in advance for your co-operation.] one of the men (link-reveal:"says.")[

(color:#76FF70)[We have been watching you. You've been attracting an... unfortunate... amount of suspicion. We know exactly what you've been getting up to. We could throw you in prison for life. (link-reveal:"Right now.")[

(link-reveal:"Unless...")[ You wish to [[help us with our enquiries.->Naming names]]]]]]]]]]]

We could not have asked for more.]](elseif: $name1 is "Your brother and his wife" or $name2 is "Your university lecturer friend" or $name3 is "The clumsy lady from the train" or $name4 is "The patrons of the resistance bar" or $name5 is "Your boss")[(color:#76FF70)[You have been co-operative. That is a good start.]](else:)[(color:#76FF70)[You have not been co-operative. This is not a good start, hm?]](if: $wrong is 0)[

(color:#76FF70)[It must be said, you were a diligent employee. We have found no fault in your corrections. This is highly commendable.]](elseif: $wrong is < 4)[

(color:#76FF70)[Your work was not of the highest standard. We found mistakes. The question must therefore be asked, was this intentional? Or were you merely sloppy?]](else:)[

(color:#76FF70)[Your work was clearly poor. It is littered with mistakes. Is this mere sloppiness? Or have you abused your position to intentionally undermine the government's authority?]](if: $harsh is > 1)[

(color:#76FF70)[Now it does look like there were occasions when you were over-officious in your amendments. Does this show your true spirit? Or perhaps you were trying to cover your tracks?]](if: $boss is "told")[

(color:#76FF70)[Now, the so-called resistance came calling, and you informed the authorities. That is good, very good. (if: "code" is true)[Though why you would then use the code is a mystery, of course. Unless you're incredibly stupid.]]](if: $code is true)[

(color:#76FF70)[You used your government salary to become a messenger for terrorists. (if: $code2 is true)[Repeatedly. ](if: $code3 is true)[Up to the bitter end. ]This is, of course, treasonous. And yes, of //course// we know all about it.]](color:#76FF70)[

How have you conducted yourself away from work, I wonder?] He flips through [[more pages.->Sentence.2]]

passages.name: Sentence.2
passages.text:
(if: $anthem is false)[(color:#76FF70)[You do not like singing the national anthem, I see. Interesting.]](elseif: $anthem is true)[(color:#76FF70)[You sing the national anthem like a true patriot. That's good.]](if: $stepin is true)[

(color:#76FF70)[You had an altercation on a train. It seems you want our women to be ogled by all and sundry. How disappointing.]](if: $friend is > 0)[

(color:#76FF70)[You have been seen in the company of a known dissident on at least $friend (if: $friend is > 1)[occasions](else:)[occasion]. (if: $name2 is "Your university lecturer friend")[But you have at least informed us about her. That shows truthfulness.]]](if:$family is > 0)[

(color:#76FF70)[We have recordings of your (if: $family is 1)[conversation](else:)[conversations] with your brother. He is an... unfortunate connection. (if: $family is > 1)[You would have been wise to sever this relationship sooner.] (if: $name1 is "Your brother and his wife")[You have informed on him to us though, so that goes in your favour.]]](if: $protest is true)[

(color:#76FF70)[Why would you attend a protest that is clearly illegal? Why would you do it? We have a photograph of you there(if: $dissident is true)[, waving your oh-so-smug placard]. What did you think would happen?]](if: $bar is true)[

(color:#76FF70)[We can place you in a bar that is known to be a hotbed of dissidents on at least one occasion. (if: $name4 is "The patrons of the resistance bar")[We will bear in mind that you have confessed to this already.]]](if: $radio + $earlynight + $reading is > 5)[

(color:#76FF70)[You tend to keep yourself to yourself. This is no bad thing. The comfort of a good book, a voice on the radio, a good night's sleep, these are things to be treasured.]](if: $dobbed is true)[

(color:#76FF70)[Our records show you helped the police apprehend one of the violent protesters a few months ago. Thank you for that service.]](if: $helpedfriend is true)[

(color:#76FF70)[You caused a scene in a bar with your dissident friend, according to eyewitness reports.]]

He steeples his fingers in front of his face, (link-reveal:"peering at you over the top.")[

(color:#76FF70)[So the question remains, [[what do we do with you?->Judgement]]]]

passages.name: Judgement
passages.text:
(if:$code is not true)[(if: $protest is not true)[(if: $suspicion is < 70)[You walk out of the police station with your head held high. Any indiscretions have been forgiven. You are a valued member of society and know how to mind your own business and do your job.](else:)[You walk out of the police station chastened, but with your head held high. Your wrists are slapped for your indiscretions, and you imagine they will be watching closely for a while. But you know how to mind your own business and get on with your job.]](else:)[(if: $suspicion is < 70)[When they mentioned the protest you thought you were done for. But you walk out of the police station with your head held high. They understand isolated indiscretions, and while you imagine they will be watching you closely, that's a small price to pay.](else:)[(if: $namednames is true)[They told you they were ready to throw the book at you. The protest, the numerous indiscretions, it all added up. But you named names. And so when you walk out of the police station it's to go home, not to go to prison. You imagine they will be watching you closely, but that's a small price to pay isn't it?](else:)[It's the protest that did for you. The protest and the myriad small indiscretions. Perhaps if you'd named names things might be different. Perhaps you've traded your freedom for someone else's. That's a decision you will have a long time to think on.]]]](else:)[The code. The code and the resistance. You'd felt a great weight hanging over you ever since the first code went into the paper, and now it has come crashing down on your head. (if:$namednames is true)[You gave them names, and perhaps that has helped. But if only you had kept yourself to yourself. If only you had minded your own business and kept your head down.](else:)[Your refusal to name names hasn't helped your case. They have taken your silence very badly. That's a decision you will have a long time to think on.] (if:$uprising is true)[You made it as far as you could though. You were ready to rise up against the government. So whatever happens to you now, at least you know you tried.](elseif:$uprising is false)[And if, after everything, you didn't want to join the uprising, well that's just between you and your conscience. Was it worth taking things this far to shy away at the last hurdle? No-one will ever know but you.] Wouldn't it have been easier to play by the rules?]  

You had never really paid attention to politics before this election, because $politicalview. At least now you know for sure [[where you stand.->End]]

passages.text:
